snippet: With Florida’s election schedule in disarray after a judge ruled the state’s congressional map unconstitutional, lawmakers on Friday approved redesigned districts — drawn in private by the two Republican committee heads, their staff and outside...
abstract: Florida lawmakers approve redesign of congressional map that was ruled to be unconstitutional; in all, seven districts in Central Florida will be slightly affected by the rejiggered map, which is expected to be approved by the Republican-controlled Florida Legislature.
lead_paragraph: With Florida’s election schedule in disarray after a judge ruled the state’s congressional map unconstitutional, lawmakers on Friday approved redesigned districts — drawn in private by the two Republican committee heads, their staff and outside lawyers.

headline.main: Florida Redraws an Election Map That Was Ruled to Be Unconstitutional
headline.print_headline: Florida Redraws an Election Map That Was Ruled to Be Unconstitutional

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
